column4: anyone know of a super secret (meaning I can't find one) GOOD wysiwyg editor that can handle php?
DO NOT write php in a wysiwyg editor.
Learn html, stop relying on wysiwyg, your files will be smaller, consume less bandwidth, work better in search engines, and work correctly in text browsers if you do
I've been designing html for 10 years, I can do it all in tags, but I'm also a good layout designer and want to see what it looks like.. so its a preference
